glsa.title: OpenSSL: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in OpenSSL, the worst of which allows attackers to conduct a time based side-channel attack.

background.p: OpenSSL is an Open Source toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) as well as a general purpose cryptography library.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenSSL. Please review the CVE identifiers and the International Association for Cryptologic Research’s (IACR) paper, “Make Sure DSA Signing Exponentiations Really are Constant-Time” for further details.

impact.p: Remote attackers could cause a Denial of Service condition or have other unspecified impacts. Additionally, a time based side-channel attack may allow a local attacker to recover a private DSA key.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All OpenSSL users should upgrade to the latest version:

references.uri: Make Sure DSA Signing Exponentiations Really are Constant-Time
